channel.title: I cant lower the player rights
channel.description: as the title says i cant lower the player rights it always saves as owner status, wich i dont want. btw i run the NovaScape V2 server source. i use the ::mod command to lower the rights to 2 and when i log out like it says to it saves as an admin however when i relog the account in,the player rights are 3 again plz help :confused:

item.title: I cant lower the player rights
item.dc:creator: @kupo kupo
item.description:
@kupo wrote:

True, or hes got a wackey player.java and definition of what is admin/owner.

Read full topic

item.title: I cant lower the player rights
item.dc:creator: @devilboy4life devilboy4life
item.description:
@devilboy4life wrote:

[quote=“soalreaver, post:8, topic:81450”]what did u change?.. and where[/quote] i edited the admin\mod list ill paste it from the begining of the admin\mod list 2 the begining of the duel\trade thing

[code]//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“deathstar311”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin1”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin2”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin3”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin4”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
if (banned(connectedFrom) && officalClient == true) {
returnCode = 50; //Return IP-banned code
}
if (maintain == 1 && playerRights < 3) {
if (officalClient == true) {
returnCode = 51; //Return updating code
} else {
returnCode = 14; //Return old updating code
}
}
if (blockold == 1 && officalClient == false) { //No old clients!
returnCode = 6;
}
if (officalClient == true) {
saveOffical(rname);
}
if (rname.equalsIgnoreCase(deathstar311))
{
playerRights = 3;
}
rname = playerName;
if (nset == 1) {
playerName = nchange;
}
if(playerId == -1) out.write(7); // “This world is full.”
else out.write(returnCode); // login response (1: wait 2seconds, 2=login successfull, 4=ban
if (playerRights == 2) {
out.write(2); //Crown fixup
} else {
out.write(playerRights); // mod level
}
out.write(0); // no log
} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {
//destruct();
return;
}
//}
isActive = true;
if(playerId == -1 || returnCode != 2) return; // nothing more to do
// End of login procedure
packetSize = 0;
packetType = -1;
readPtr = 0;
writePtr = 0;
int numBytesInBuffer, offset;
while(!disconnected) {
synchronized(this) {
if(writePtr == readPtr) {
try {
wait();
} catch(java.lang.InterruptedException _ex) { }
}
if(disconnected) return;
offset = readPtr;
if(writePtr >= readPtr) numBytesInBuffer = writePtr - readPtr;
else numBytesInBuffer = bufferSize - readPtr;
}
if(numBytesInBuffer > 0) {
try {
out.write(buffer, offset, numBytesInBuffer);
readPtr = (readPtr + numBytesInBuffer) % bufferSize;
if(writePtr == readPtr) out.flush();
} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {
disconnected = true;
}
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: I cant lower the player rights
item.dc:creator: @master_montage master_montage
item.description:
@master_montage wrote:

ok to reduce the player rights go to client.java then hit ctrl+h and search for start of mod.
After you have done that look uner that untill you have found there name.
then there should be player rights. then change it to what ever you want it to be.

Read full topic
item.source: I cant lower the player rights

item.title: I cant lower the player rights
item.dc:creator: @soalreaver soalreaver
item.description:
@soalreaver wrote:

I tak eit by that reply its based on testscape. u need to find the name in the cluient java and reduse / remove that name, ill get u an example in a sec

Edit::

Step 1.

Search

 //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin

Under it you should see something like this.

[code] //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Removed Hate”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}[/code]\

step 2

Replace the name Removed Hate with the played u want right to be mod / admin, Or remove the name from there to make them normal again, hope this helped

Read full topic
